basics.description: FinOps hubs are a reliable, trustworthy platform for cost analytics, insights, and optimization. Connect your hub to one or more billing accounts and subscriptions and build custom reports in Power BI or other tools. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/finops/hubs)

basics.name: hubName
basics.label: Hub name
basics.toolTip: Name of the FinOps hub instance. Used to ensure unique resource names.

constraints.validationMessage: Name must be between 3 and 63 characters long and can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. The first and last characters in the name must be alphanumeric.

options.text: Azure Data Explorer is a fast, scalable service for advanced, big data analytics. Data Explorer is optional but recommended when monitoring more than $100K in spend. FinOps hubs with Data Explorer starts at $120/mo for a single node cluster plus $10/mo per million in monitored spend (<0.02% of annual spend).

elements.name: dataExplorerName
elements.label: Cluster name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Azure Data Explorer cluster, if desired. If not specified, Data Explorer will not be deployed.

constraints.validationMessage: Name must be between 4 and 22 characters long and can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. The first and last characters in the name must be alphanumeric.

options.text: Microsoft Fabric is a unified data platform for data ingestion, processing, and analytics. FinOps hubs with Fabric starts at $300/mo for an F2 SKU plus $10/mo per million in monitored spend.

elements.name: fabricQueryUri
elements.label: Fabric eventhouse query URI
elements.toolTip: Query URI for the Microsoft Fabric eventhouse, if applicable.

constraints.validationMessage: Query URI must be a full Microsoft Fabric eventhouse URL.

elements.name: fabricCapacity
elements.label: Fabric capacity
elements.toolTip: Fabric capacity configured for this workspace. This must be set at deployment time to tune data ingestion performance. If you update the capacity, redeploy this template.

options.text: Estimated costs below are based on list prices for the default settings. Refer to the Azure pricing calculator for the most accurate pricing based on your discounts. Learn more @ https://aka.ms/finops/hubs/calculator
FinOps hubs utilize Azure Data Factory for data processing and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 for staging during data ingestion.
Estimated cost: Starts at ~$5/mo per million in monitored spend*.

elements.name: storageSku
elements.label: Storage redundancy
elements.toolTip: The data in your storage account is always replicated to ensure durability and high availability. Choose a replication strategy that matches your durability requirements. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2163103)

options.text: Azure Data Explorer is optional. If a cluster name is not specified on the Basics tab, this setting is ignored.
Added cost: Starts at $120/mo plus another ~$5/mo per million in monitored spend* (<0.02% of annual spend).

elements.name: dataExplorerSku
elements.label: Data Explorer SKU
elements.defaultValue: Dev/test: D11_v2 (no SLA) - Extra small, 78GB cache (~$121/mo)
elements.toolTip: Select an Azure Data Explorer SKU based on your needs. Consider how many accounts and datasets that are required for your needs. We recommend starting small and scaling up based on performance. [Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/data-explorer/manage-cluster-choose-sku)

allowedValues.label: Dev/test: E2a_v4 (no SLA) - Extra small, 24GB cache (~$110/mo)
Dev/test: D11_v2 (no SLA) - Extra small, 78GB cache (~$121/mo)

options.text: * Monitored spend refers to how much cost data is stored based on desired retention. For instance, $1 million per month in spend for 13 months is $13 million in monitored spend. The basic deployment with Data Explorer would be $250/mo - $120/mo for a single node cluster plus $10 times 13 for Data Factory and storage costs.
Data retention settings indicate how long to keep data available for reporting or additional processing. Retained data contributes to monitored spend and the total storage costs for the hub instance.
Storage retention is not implemented yet. You can set the retention period but files will not be automatically removed.

elements.name: msexportsDays
elements.label: Export retention (days)
elements.toolTip: Indicates how many days Cost Management exports are kept in the msexports container. If 0, exported data will be deleted after ingestion. Manifest files are always retained for troubleshooting. If set to any higher value, exported data will be retained indefinitely. This retention setting has not been implemented yet.

constraints.validationMessage: Number of days must be between 0 and 9999.

elements.name: ingestionMonths
elements.label: Ingestion retention (months)
elements.toolTip: Indicates how many months exported data is kept in the ingestion container. This retention setting has not been implemented yet.

constraints.validationMessage: Number of months must be between 0 and 99.

options.text: Azure Data Explorer is optional. If a cluster name is not specified on the Basics tab, this setting is ignored.

elements.name: rawDays
elements.label: Raw data retention (days)
elements.toolTip: Indicates how many days ingested data should be retained in 'raw' tables. If 0, ingested data is deleted immediately after ingested into 'final' (normalized) tables.

constraints.validationMessage: Number of days must be between 0 and 9999.

elements.name: finalMonths
elements.label: Normalized data retention (months)
elements.toolTip: Indicates how many closed (complete) months data should be retained in 'final' (normalized) tables. If 0, ingested data is deleted on the first of the next month. This retention setting is only enforced when new data is ingested. If data ingestion stops, historical data will be retained indefinitely.

constraints.validationMessage: Number of months must be between 0 and 99.

options.text: Infrastructure encryption can be enabled for the entire storage account. To enable infrastructure encryption for this storage account, you must check this box at the time that you deploy this template. Learn more. To learn about pricing for encryption scopes, see Blob Storage pricing.

elements.name: enableInfrastructureEncryption
elements.label: Enable Infrastructure Encryption
elements.toolTip: Infrastructure encryption is recommended for scenarios where doubly encrypting data is necessary for compliance requirements. For most other scenarios, Azure Storage encryption provides a sufficiently powerful encryption algorithm, and there is unlikely to be a benefit to using infrastructure encryption unless for compliance requirements.

options.text: Managed exports allow your FinOps hub instance to create and run Cost Management exports on your behalf using a schedule you define. This feature is not supported for Microsoft Customer Agreement (MCA) billing profiles.

elements.name: enableManagedExports
elements.label: Enable managed exports
elements.toolTip: Creating exports in Cost Management requires the User Access Administrator role. You must have access to grant User Access Administrator to your FinOps hub to enable managed exports.

options.text: For enhanced security, consider blocking external access to your FinOps hub instance to enable secure, private connectivity to your cloud resources by eliminating exposure to the public internet. Private endpoints can incur significant additional cost. Please understand the cost impact before selecting this option.

elements.name: enablePublicAccess
elements.label: Access
elements.toolTip: Indicate whether FinOps hubs resources should be accessible by the internet or not. If set to private, all resources will be hidden behind a virtual network private endpoint. This will incur additional costs for data crossing virtual network boundaries and for virtual network peering, if configured.

allowedValues.label: Public
allowedValues.description: Allow external access to storage and Data Explorer.

allowedValues.label: Private
allowedValues.description: Block all external access. This will incur additional charges.

elements.name: virtualNetworkAddressPrefix
elements.label: Address prefix
elements.toolTip: Address space for the workload. Minimum /26 subnet size is required for the workload.

validations.message: Address prefix must be a valid IPv4 address in the format 'XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX/YY' where YY is between 8 and 26 (minimum /26 subnet size required).

options.text: Configure this hub to send data to a remote FinOps hub in another tenant or subscription. This enables cross-tenant cost management scenarios where a central tenant collects cost data from multiple tenants. Leave these fields empty if this is not a remote hub setup.

elements.name: remoteHubStorageUri
elements.label: Remote hub storage URI
elements.toolTip: Data Lake storage endpoint from the remote hub storage account. Copy from the storage account Settings > Endpoints > Data Lake storage. Example: https://myremotehub.dfs.core.windows.net/

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Data Lake storage endpoint URL in the format: https://storageaccount.dfs.core.windows.net/

elements.name: remoteHubStorageKey
elements.toolTip: Storage account access key for the remote hub. Copy from the remote hub storage account Security + networking > Access keys > key1/2 > Key.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid storage account access key (base64 encoded, ending with ==)

options.text: Customize resource names and networking configuration for your FinOps hub deployment. All settings on this page are optional.
Leave fields empty to use auto-generated names following Azure naming best practices.

elements.name: storageAccountName
elements.label: Storage Account name
elements.toolTip: Name for the Azure Storage Account. Must be globally unique, 3-24 characters, lowercase letters and numbers only.

constraints.validationMessage: Storage Account name must be 3-24 characters long and contain only lowercase letters and numbers.

elements.name: dataFactoryName
elements.label: Data Factory name
elements.toolTip: Name for the Azure Data Factory instance. Must be 3-63 characters, alphanumeric and hyphens only.

constraints.validationMessage: Data Factory name must be 3-63 characters long, start and end with alphanumeric characters, and contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens.

elements.name: keyVaultName
elements.label: Key Vault name
elements.toolTip: Name for the Azure Key Vault. Must be globally unique, 3-24 characters, alphanumeric and hyphens only.

constraints.validationMessage: Key Vault name must be 3-24 characters long, start with a letter, end with alphanumeric character, and contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens.

elements.name: virtualNetworkName
elements.label: Virtual Network name
elements.toolTip: Name for the Azure Virtual Network. Must be 2-64 characters, alphanumeric, hyphens, underscores, and periods only.

constraints.validationMessage: Virtual Network name must be 2-64 characters long, start and end with alphanumeric characters, and contain only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, underscores, and periods.

elements.name: managedIdentityName
elements.label: Managed Identity name
elements.toolTip: Name for the User-Assigned Managed Identity. Must be 3-128 characters, alphanumeric, hyphens, and underscores only.

constraints.validationMessage: Managed Identity name must be 3-128 characters long and contain only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores.

elements.name: dataExplorerClusterName
elements.label: Data Explorer cluster name
elements.toolTip: Name for the Azure Data Explorer cluster (if enabled). Must be globally unique, 4-22 characters, lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only.

constraints.validationMessage: Data Explorer cluster name must be 4-22 characters long, start and end with lowercase alphanumeric characters, and contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

elements.name: privateEndpointNamePrefix
elements.label: Private Endpoint name prefix
elements.toolTip: Prefix for all Private Endpoint names. The service type will be appended (e.g., '{prefix}-blob', '{prefix}-vault').

constraints.validationMessage: Private Endpoint prefix must start with alphanumeric character and contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens.

options.text: If you're deploying in a Hub & Spoke topology with centralized Private DNS Zones, provide the resource IDs of existing DNS Zones. This prevents creating duplicate DNS Zones and enables proper DNS resolution across your network. Leave empty to create new Private DNS Zones.

elements.name: existingBlobDnsZoneId
elements.label: Blob Storage DNS Zone ID
elements.toolTip: Resource ID of existing Private DNS Zone for Blob Storage (privatelink.blob.core.windows.net). Example: /subscriptions/{sub-id}/resourceGroups/{rg}/providers/Microsoft.Network/privateDnsZones/privatelink.blob.core.windows.net

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Azure resource ID for a Private DNS Zone or empty.

elements.name: existingDfsDnsZoneId
elements.label: Data Lake Storage DNS Zone ID
elements.toolTip: Resource ID of existing Private DNS Zone for Data Lake Storage (privatelink.dfs.core.windows.net).

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Azure resource ID for a Private DNS Zone or empty.

elements.name: existingQueueDnsZoneId
elements.label: Queue Storage DNS Zone ID
elements.toolTip: Resource ID of existing Private DNS Zone for Queue Storage (privatelink.queue.core.windows.net).

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Azure resource ID for a Private DNS Zone or empty.

elements.name: existingTableDnsZoneId
elements.label: Table Storage DNS Zone ID
elements.toolTip: Resource ID of existing Private DNS Zone for Table Storage (privatelink.table.core.windows.net).

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Azure resource ID for a Private DNS Zone or empty.

elements.name: existingVaultDnsZoneId
elements.label: Key Vault DNS Zone ID
elements.toolTip: Resource ID of existing Private DNS Zone for Key Vault (privatelink.vaultcore.azure.net).

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Azure resource ID for a Private DNS Zone or empty.

elements.name: existingDataExplorerDnsZoneId
elements.label: Data Explorer DNS Zone ID
elements.toolTip: Resource ID of existing Private DNS Zone for Data Explorer (privatelink.{region}.kusto.windows.net). The region must match your deployment location.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid Azure resource ID for a Private DNS Zone or empty.

elements.name: tagsByResource
elements.label: Tags
elements.toolTip: Tags to apply to resources.
